comment: A lot of work. A whole lot of work. Gives good feedback, grading rubic is always clear, and she seems pretty nice, but the amount of assignments you have to pay attention to, is very stressful. There are multiple group assingments, so make sure to participate in them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: This class was HEAVY with weekly readings. Atleast 2-3 group projects. Weekly quizzes some sort of writing assignment, kind of tedious. At some point I did start to appreciate the creativity that this class bring out of you. Professor Behrman is passionate about literature, very caring and provides creative and awesome feedback and extra credit!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Horrible teacher, got sick halfway through the semester and she never gave any sort of leniency even with required doctors notes and medical excuses, had to drop the class to avoid failing out. Grades too harshly and doesnt let students choose research topic. A lot of busywork, no real learning. The final essay was had too much criteria to finish.
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things--Lots of homework

comment: I would not take this class again. The beginning half of the class is a lot of assignments at once. You have assignments due every Tuesday and Thursday. At the end of the semester, everything culminates into the final research papers. She also has very high grading expectations on these final papers.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! For being a GEN ED class, this is way harder than it needs to be. Classwork is Dues Tuesday and Thursday. Crazy amounts of reading. Does not care if you have other classwork. There is also ZERO lectures and she just assigns textbook readings and that's it. Also, you have to earn up to your grade. Starts at 0% and not 100%
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I'm not in literature major, just have to take this class as a general course. Her test is unnecessary hard with 45 multiple choices, which seem to be so much harder for a college student level, and an essay. There's tons of work due on every tuesday and thursday, if you're planning to take more than 2 classes per semester, don't take this class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: I really enjoyed British Literature with Dr. Behrman. Originally I thought I was going to find old British literature boring, but all the literature we read was very entertaining. A lot of the literature are in the original language and either A. it is easy to read or B. she provides a translated version of it and it helps a lot. TAKE THIS CLASS!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Be ready to read a lot and be busy. I had assignments due 2-3 times a week. HOWEVER! Even though it is a lot of work I did find it very helpful for all classes that requires essays and research papers to be done. I did hate the work load but I am so happy it was done. She is always there to help you out if you are struggling with writing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: For a freshman-level english class, she expects too much. She's nice but assigns a ridiculous amount of work (one week she posted around 20 homework tasks, albeit some were simple tasks like "watch this video"). The assignments are posted on Saturday with half due on Tuesday and the other half on Thursday. I dropped this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: she has too much work during the week. there's about 4 things due in the middle of the week and you get overwhelmed easily. would not recommend her at all unless you're and English major
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Behrman is a very nice person, but some of the assignments given in this class seemed odd, or unnecessarily difficult. Expect to do 2 quizzes a week plus writing assignments. Some of the writing assignments were done via a google docs page shared with the class which was annoying. Time given on exams seemed short for the amount of work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Took Dr. Behrman during Fall 2019. She's a great teacher, but you definitely need to work for your grade. I had online class and she made it very organized and made clear what's due every week and where to find it. She also has lectures uploaded.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I took Professor Behrman online last semester and she was AMAZING! I am not a fan of English or literature classes, but this one was different. She always responded quickly to emails and was very clear in her response. She posted videos that went over the topic of the week and provided clear summaries of the readings. I wish I could take her again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: There are assignments due weekly. She asks you to read a lot, but I got my A without reading all of it ( I read a lot of one or two of the texts, none of the others). Quizzes and discussions are easy. If you have an issue, she usually emailed me back pretty quickly, but she was not always straightforward with feedback. Expect to write a lot, too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Behrman is a very caring and smart professor. She is always ready to answer questions and replies to emails promptly. She gives very helpful feedback to assignments and papers. You can tell she is very organized and her method works if you follow. Ask questions! If you feel stuck or lost, ask. Shell always answer. Dont give up. All the best!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Please do not make the same mistake I did taking this class, take it anywhere else but here. There are a ton of busy work she makes you do that are basically meaningless toward the big papers and you are basically on your own with those papers. There's huge chance I have to take ENGL 1102 again, but at least next time I will get a better teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: My experience has been the same as others. Huge amounts of busy work and lots off huge essays and projects. Do yourself a favor and just either take the eCore version of go to a traditional classroom if possible. To sum it all up in one sentence: This is the most ridiculous 3 credit hour class I have ever taken.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I have an A in this class, but only bc I've spent 12+hr each week on hw. I'm dropping this class bc she just assigns a TON of complex reading that's hard to understand and complex assignments every T and Th and she's a hard grader. For the 8-12p research paper, we have to ask a question that connects language & identity with ZERO direction from her
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Assignments open on Saturday and you have to read 1 chapter plus its homework by Tuesday and another one by Thursday, tons of work which is going to consume half of your time so if you are taking more than 4 classes don't take it with her
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Spend at least 4 hours on assignments every T & Th. 7 if u want an A. There's TONS of reading. Syllabus is 22p long and confusing. her D2l is also confusing. She grades subjectively, so your analytical opinions better match hers. If you are interested in the subject, like reading, and want a challenge, take her. Otherwise, run and save your GPA.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Proffesor Behrman is a very sweet lady and it is clear that she enjoys the material she teaches. A lot of the reading is Old and Middle English so it can be a little difficult but she's really big on class discussion and that helps. I genuinely enjoyed her class.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: So I took her COMP 1102 class online. She's very clear on what is due and when and how to do it. But she gives a ridiculous amount of work every week. 4 or 5 things due by Tuesday and 4 or 5 more due by Thursday. The papers aren't too hard but there are a lot of them. You have to read the book. The content is interesting enough, unique.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Has 3 tests, which are half multiple choice and half short essay. Difficult, especially if you skip class or don't read. But she offers multiple extra credit opportunities. Lectures can be engaging if you get into the subject even a little. Not an easy A, you'll have to work for it, but definitely a passable class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Tests are tough

comment: Dr. Behrman is a very nice and smart lady, and although she gives a lot of work, it does all have a purpose. That being said, she's not always clear on what she wants for an assignment, and sometimes she puts a bit too much emphasis on scholarly writing for a required freshman English class. But maybe that will help us later.... who knows.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Behrman LOVES busy work! However, as the semester progressed, I realized that there is a method to her madness. All of the quizzes, required readings and short assignments prepare you for the final research paper that is due at the end of the semester. If you enjoy linguistics and writing, you will enjoy this class. I would recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Take her class!!! Dr. Behrman is my favorite professor at KSU thus far. She really knows her stuff and makes learning about Brit Lit very interesting! You will have to take good notes and actually read, but it is so worth it. She is very nice and does her best to help her students. Take her class if you want to actually learn something!:-)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Behrman is a wonderful professor and her class was very enjoyable. Some other students may say this class was hard, but it's only hard if you do not take time and do the work like any other class. She does grade a tad harder, but she is a college level professor so that is to be expected.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Be careful. If you take Dr. Behrman for British Lit, you might actually enjoy the subject!!! Her passion for literature is contagious. Getting good grades in this class is a challenge, her tests are not easy (that is an example of litotes). But it is totally worth it. Unless you are allergic to work, take Dr. Behrman!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class is the hardest class i have ever taken. You have reading hw due EVERY class! She can teach well but her test are crazy hard. The test are in 3 parts (25 Multiple choice, character identification and summery anal)  1st test is 10% of your grade the 2nd is 15% and the 3rd is 20%. you also have 12  quizs which are worth 10%. DONT TAKE HER!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is a very sweet lady, but this class is HARD. The tests are the hardest part, multiple choice, fill in the blank and a section where you have to write paragraphs identifying passages from the book and analyze them. Very difficult. The material is lots of old english; hard to understand. Lots of online quizzes and an essay. Would not take again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Behrman has been my favorite professor here so far. She cares about people individually. She will grade your paper without any bias and she gives great feedback. It can be tough at times to earn an A on a paper, but you will actually learn in this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: She's nice. She does give great feedback. She critiques on your writing so you better know how to write. It's best to be in class for her discussions. And yes of course you have to read. If you like English, then it will be easy peasy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is very funny, but a very tough grader.

This is the best professor I have had at KSU. She is passionate about what she teaches and it helped me pay attention and learn. This is a hard class. There is a lot of reading, 4 exams, one essay, several pop quizzes, and announced quizzes. I worked really hard for my "B." Everyone gets 3 excused absences, but don't skip. Show up, take notes  B.

Pop quizzes and 3 tests were the grades. You just need to read what is assigned and go to class. She goes over just about everything that will be on the tests in class, but it requires some effort on your part. Just don't lay around and expect an easy B; it needs some effort on your part.

Great English professor. Makes it fun and gives only 2 papers in the semester, only 1 test. Great presentations, not too tough grader but says she is. Great class participation and great professor. Would definitely take again, she's a great person.

Sweet lady, awesome person. As a professor, however, she's not the best. She's an incredibly tough grader, she admits to it, but she doesn't give you any sort of criteria for what she wants or how she grades. It's very hard to make anything above a mid "B" on her papers, and this is coming from a fairly decent writer. I wouldn't take her again.

Dr. Behrman LOVES busy work. Practically her entire class is busy work, actually. I sorta feel like I'm in a freshman high school class from all the busy work. She's a tough grader but is not very clear about what she wants. You have to really work to get good grades in her class. She loves making you read and give pop quizzes about them.

Gives a ton of busy work and it is ridiculous! Very sweet and loves to help students.  Her whole class is busy work, nothing ever really seems to be needed or make sense as to why we are doing it. Read a book basically every month.  Expects students to read tons of material, like students don't have any other homework.

Not many quizzes, or too much required reading, 4 essays, 4th is the final. Gives good feedback, better writer after this class. Very sweet and cares about students. Go to her offices hours and writing center,put effort. Easy B, but work for the A.
Solid professor. A lot of reading but what do you expect in a World Lit course Not an easy A but engaging discourse. Behrman is well-versed and erudite but never pedantic. Take her.
Prof Behrman is very nice and helpful. She understands what she is teaching. She uploads grades on time and keeps everything up to date. She's a good teacher.

DON'T DO IT!!! Just saying. You'll write a lot and she may not like WHAT you've wrote and she'll hate HOW you wrote it. If you're failing she'll just silently watch but then she'll tell you to take her again. I did great in her class but I know many who didn't.

Anyone who says this class is hard obviously wasn't prepared for a college level course. There were like 4 total papers all semester and our final was to write a letter. She likes when you get involved in discussions but basically you just have to show up and not be a completely terrible writer and you're good. Not a hard class, just don't be lazy.
She is a great professor and helpful.

1st Day of class she says, "as most of you are coming out of high school you probably think a C is a bad grade, but it's not a C means your right where you should be. C means you are college competent."C is a bad grade, i it will drop your GPA. Her grading system is unfair, otherwise the class interesting. If you don't care about grades, take it

This class pushed my writing skills to where they have never gone before. Put in the extra time, then you will do well. There's one paper that you work on the whole semester, discussion posts online, and a few more grades. The first paper has to be 8 pages, then second paper is 2 more. You read 2 or 3 books also. She's very sweet and helpful!

Many of the people in my class found her to be a very hard grader on papers, but she is simply strict about citations, like most teachers. She doesn't assign very much reading and the one paper for the class makes up like 60% of your grade. Writing is one of my strengths so I got an A.

I went into Dr. Behrman's class with the attitude that I wanted to become a better writer. I was impressed by her dedication to her students. She gave each of us personal attention and was very helpful with our papers. If you have a good attitude and put in the work, you will do well in her class. Her class is not for lazy people.

Dr. Behrman is a fantastic professor.  She is highly enthusiastic and wants her students to be as well.  She is a harsh grader, but is always willing to help students if they are having trouble.  She made the class very thought-provoking and interesting.  Attendance is mandatory.

Professor Berhman is not easy by any definition, but she has a real passion for what she teaches and that shines through in here class and makes the material a little less dry. She also gives you all the tools you need to succeed, so if you attend class, pay attention, and do the required reading it is very possible to pull a good grade.

Dr. Behrman's class was more interesting this semester than last, that's for sure. She is very demanding when it comes to work and is a harsh grader, but she does make you a better writer. Also, there were more discussion board topics this time around. Make sure to stay on top of your reading, discussion boards, and do well on your papers!
She is very helpful, but her classes are very demanding. She does make you a better writer. Not an easy A but it is possible if you give her exactly what she discusses in class.
Interesting lady from day one..also does help improve with writing, but not always a fair grader . I would not take her again even though there were points where I enjoyed her class.

Dr. Behrman is a really great professor. Her class is a little difficult because some of the readings are a little tough to understand, but she's great about working with you outside of class. She's very understanding. She's funny and very intelligent and provides helpful comments on your work. TAKE HER!

If you want an easy class, this is not the one for you.  However, if you actually want to learn and become a better writer, take Professor Behrman.  She grades very hard and the text is difficult to understand.  Needless to say, you will learn a lot in her class.  After all, is that not the whole point of college?
Excellent Professor! take her no matter what.

She's very nice and super intelligent. The books get used daily and is very vital. Its English of course its boring but she tries to make it fun. I never got the book and some days I suffered because I don't like looking on with others but if you would love a challenge from someone who's very nice I recommend her.

The class is boring. I managed to make it through the whole course without buying one of the books. The class can be difficult but not impossible to do well in. She is very nice and we have great discussions sometimes.

She uses the book a lot. No tests so that's not a problem. There aren't any quizes either. She means good but the class is really boring. All you do is write papers, some discussions, and most of the time go over what you read prior to attending class. Take her if you're good at papers otherwise don't.

She has a great personality and can be funny, but her class is so boring. All we talk about is war, and more than half the class has no idea what is going on. She grades papers kind of harshly, and it is almost impossible to get an A on a paper. She uses the book a lot, so you need to be prepared. There's debates in the class too

Her personality really makes the class enjoyable, however, her work is difficult. I come to class knowing nothing and leave an hour and 15 minutes later... knowing nothing. She isn't very helpful and doesn't explain things thoroughly, making the class hard. Make sure you come to class prepared to save yourself from embarrassment.
